CAREER SUMMARY  
 
October 2019 – Present: Technical Support Engineer at Ritherdon & Co Ltd.  
 Product Development – Worked as part of a team to reduce cost and improve 
performance of products.  
 CAD design – Used RADAN to design and manufacture testing equipment and 
prototypes of new pr oducts.  
 Conducted internal testing to evaluate performance of our products to 
identify development opportunities.  
 Created detailed datasheets and installation guides for our entire product 
range, centralising all relevant  
 technical information which in creased productivity of technical and sales 
departments.  
 Wrote Approval in Principle (AIP) documents for technical approval of 
products by National Highways.  
 Carried out risk assessments for products as part of UKCA/CE declarations of 
performance.  
 Exposure to lean manufacturing methods such as 5S to optimise workflow 
and manufacturing.  
 Organised and managed external testing of our products with TIC service 
providers.  
 Developed communication skills through hosting meetings with customers 
and ex tensive customer -facing work.  
 Relaying technical information on our products to a variety of audiences.  
 
   
 Programming Web Chatbot AI to automate responses to FAQs to save time 
and increase productivity.  
 
July 2017 – July 2018: Process Development at Fiber Lean™ Technologies Ltd.  
 Developed a new sustainable FiberLean™ Multi Fibrillated Cellulose (MFC) 
product made using recycled waste  
 materials used to reduce raw material requirements during paper 
manufacture and improve physical properties.  
 Conducted pi lot scale testing of a new separation technology with the aim of 
reducing capital and operational  
 expenditure by 50%, then travelled to Sweden to conduct scale -up testing 
with a vendor.  
 Trained in the operation of new industrial equipment and used it to perform 
experiments aiming to reduce the  
 cost and environmental impact of international product transport.  
 Undertook night shifts to collaborate in large -scale company trials achieving a 
30% product throughput increase.  
 Applied industrial risk manageme nt and reduction techniques including LOTO 
and Regulation 12.  
 Performed lab testing to determine the tensile strength, particle size 
distribution and composition of samples.  
 Generated detailed investigative reports and delivered presentations to 
divers e audiences.  
 
 
COMMENT  
A prize -winning graduate Chemical Engineering MEng student with industrial 
placement experience planning to  
begin a career in the process engineering industry after time spent in the 
manufacturing industry. Key skills d eveloped in  
product development, pilot -scale/scale -up testing, plant modelling using Excel and 
HYSYS, AutoCAD and RADAN design.
